extraction.title: [CLOSED] Layout Issues v4.02 on Galaxy S2
extraction.description: Issue by ijwhite from Thursday Nov 28, 2013 at 21:31 GMT Originally opened as binarybucks/mqttitude#216On the samsung Galaxy S2:Datetime is truncated leaving on the seconds value of the time visible (the rest is scrolled off the top of the view) both on the map view and Locations viewLng/Lat overwrite each other due to fine precision values Galaxy S4 is fine.

Could you please show us a screenshot?Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub: binarybucks/mqttitude#216 (comment) Comment by binarybucks from Friday Dec 20, 2013 at 18:01 GMTI'm just reworking the layouts to easier support different screen-sizes. I generally have an issue with the accuracy and time information shown together with a contact's location. I don't want to make a contact view higher than two rows, of which one is needed for the name and one for the location. Both, however, could take up the whole row horizontallyCan we come up with a clever way to display the information that doesn't take up so much space? Mind, that a single tap on a contact is taken for any popup invoking touch action. I thought of a long press on a contact to bring up a dialog with additional information (somewhere I also have to integrate future geofence UI things).Any better idea?
